answers.answer: Are they considering Hemiplegic Migraine?  This can simulate a stroke and occasionally can have the headaches and weakness of the one side last weeks.  I can't talk now, but here is a linkhttp://www.relieve-migraine-headache.com/headache-hemiplegic-migraine.htmlI'll look further later.Quix

Thanks so much for that link.  No they haven't meintioned that, but I do have severe high blood pressure and diabetes and I currently take several medications for blood pressure and diabetes.  The funny thing about that would be that my headache has never went away.  Needless to say, some days are worse than others but it never fully goes away.  Most nights I have to sleep with an ice pak on my head.  I have to get up in the middle of the night several times to switch out paks.  I am on a beta blocker and an antidepressant which they say should help the Hemiplegic mirgraine, so I am not sure.  Thanks so much for the link though and I will pass that information on to my doctor.
Has anyone ever heard of a pseudo tumor??  Please let me know if u have.  Thanks

question: I know that this may sound crazy but about a month ago I got a really bad headache and 2 days after my headache came on I was laying on the couch and develop severe left side numbness and weakness(I was unable to control my arm or leg).  My face became drawn to the left and my speech slurred.  I was taken to the hospital in an ambulance.  I am a 27-year old female with high blood pressure, and diabetes.  They have done many test such as ekg's, spinal tap, caratoid artery doppler, renal artery doppler, ct of my brain and a chest x-ray.  All of these test came back normal.They did a MRI of my brain and it states that there is a 4 mm mass of white matter in the left inferior anterior parietal lobe.  They say that all of my blood work appears normal also.I still yet to this day have a headache, some days is worse than others.  I have to sleep most nights with an ice pack directly on top of my head.  I have finally after about 2 weeks got use of my arm and leg except my arm burns in my muscles in it when I use it and my leg is still weak and sometimes goes numb.  Everyone is wanting to relate it back to my spine(i have had 2 spinal fusions and still have about 5-6 discs that are messed up in my back) but they spinal surgeon does not want to do anything until he figures out what is going on with my head.I just had a normal EEG that was recorded during wakefulness and drowsiness.  And also my doctor just had me wear a heart holter monitor in which he discuss my heart had severe palpitations that he has now placed me on a new medication for.If anyone has any suggestions for other test please let me know.  Thanks so much.
title: Headache that never leaves
